definitions.definition: The state of being ambiguous ; the state of leaving room for more than one interpretation.
examples: His speech was made with such great ambiguity that neither supporter nor opponent could be certain of his true position.

definitions.definition: An instance of this state: words or statements that are open to more than one interpretation , explanation or meaning , especially if that meaning cannot be determined from the context .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The state of being ambiguous ; the state of leaving room for more than one interpretation.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An instance of this state: words or statements that are open to more than one interpretation , explanation or meaning , especially if that meaning cannot be determined from the context .
